column4: Hi to all : ) Can someone guide me how to make ethernet to load at start-up. I have 3 NICs, 1 build onboard and 2 PCI. The Build-in is autostart, but the PCI not. I need to manually "ifconfig ethX up" everytime. thankx.
My PCI nic is DLink 530TX Gigabit and DLink 528TX 100Mbit. The on board NIC is nForce MCP61 Gigabit.
set up the three intrfaces in /etc/network/interfaces. make sure the three have an auto ethn line
go to paste.ubuntu.com website. paste the file there and press the button paste. give us here the url
where are the entries for eth0 and eth2 ?
maybe the driver is not loaded in time ? tried listing the nic drivers explicity in /etc/modules ?
find out what drivers the nic use ( for nvidia integrated is forcedeth ) and add it to the file « echo "forcedeth" | sudo tee -a /etc/modules »
what does this mean "In order to enable or disable this script just change the execution bits" found it in the rc.local test
it means that if you want the script to not run on boot just disable the execute permissions
this restores the eXecutable perm. --> sudo chmod +x /etc/rc.local
stefan33 and sipior.... thankx guys... my ethernet start-up as expected. thankx again :)
